Main Page | Namespace List | Class Hierarchy | Alphabetical List | Class List | File List | Namespace Members | Class Members | File Members

PlatformAdapter Class Reference

#include <PlatformAdapter.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The platform adapter is the adapter to the underlying system libraries, such as DirectX or OpenGL.

The adapter is used by the skin, but it may also be used by the application (or game), if an abstraction from the system libraries is required. The platform adapter provides primitive rendering operations such as lines, rectangles, images, font, and so on. It is set when initializing the desktop.

The choice of the right platform adapter typically results from the platform (PC, Mac, Linux, ...) and the rendering technology (DirectX, OpenGL, ...). You can choose one of the provided implementations, but you can also implement your own one.

See also:
Desktop

Desktop::createInstance()

DirectXPlatformAdapter

Definition at line 34 of file PlatformAdapter.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum BlendType
 

Enumeration values:
BLENDTYPE_NORMAL  Renders the image, text, and/or modulation color as normal.

The color of the source pixels is blended with the target pixels using the source alpha channel as blend factor (0 is transparent, 1 is opaque). The alpha of the source pixels is smooth-added to the target alpha, i.e. the new alpha as source + target - source*target. This gives a natural look when using the target as another draw's source.

BLENDTYPE_OPAQUE  Renders the image, text, and/or modulation color without blending.

Both the color and the alpha channel of the source pixels are rendered on the target, overwriting the previous content. When using the target as another draw's source, if alpha is not fully supported, opaque is a good fallback.

BLENDTYPE_SILHOUETTE  Renders only a silhouette of the image or text, using the modulation color as color.

Color and alpha blending with the target is done exactly the same way as BLENDTYPE_NORMAL.

BLENDTYPE_STENCIL  Renders the alpha channel of the image or text directly to the target alpha channel.

The source color is not used, and the target color is not modified. No blending takes place at all.

virtual void clear (  DrawingContext &  context,
unsigned long  fillColor = GL_BLACK
)  [virtual]
 

Clears the entire surface defined by a drawing context.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
fillColor The fill color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color. Defaults to black.

Clears the contents of the system's clipboard or at least the text version of it, so that getClipboardText() will return an empty string.

Creates a new font object for a given font file path.

Parameters:
path The path of the font file, may be relative or absolute. Relative paths are relative to the application's executable location.

The new font object.

Image::Type  imageType
)  [protected, virtual]

Parameters:
path The path of the font file, may be relative or absolute. Relative paths are relative to the application's executable location.
imageType The type of the image (whether the image contains RGB and/or alpha information).
Returns:
The new image object.

virtual Mutex* createMutex (   )  [virtual]
 

Creates a new mutex object for inter-thread synchronisation.

Only needed when working with multiple thread, using createThread. Use rarely.

Returns:
The new mutex. You must delete this object after use.
See also:
createThread()

Image* createRenderTarget (  Vector  size,
Image::Type  imageType = Image::TYPE_RGB_ALPHA
) 
 

Creates a new render target image.

Parameters:
size The initial size of the image.
imageType The type of the image (whether the image contains RGB and/or alpha information). Defaults to TYPE_RGB_ALPHA.
Returns:
The new image object.
Note:
The object is managed by the platform adapter, but it may be destroyed calling destroyRenderTargetImage().
See also:
destroyRenderTarget()

virtual Thread* createThread (  int(*  function)(Thread &thread, void *parameter),
void *  parameter
)  [virtual]
 

Creates a new thread for a given function or static method.

The thread starts in suspended state, so you have to resume it to start it.

Parameters:
function The function or static method to create the thread for.
parameter The parameter to be passed to the function. May be NULL.
Returns:
The new thread. Glaziery is not thread-safe in the most part of it. All glaziery objects (including windows, fields, etc.) may not be accessed by any other thread than the main thread. Concurrent threads created using the platform adapter's createThread method must therefore place operations on Glaziery objects into a deferral queue. Use Desktop::deferOperation() from any concurrent thread. Some classes also provide convenience methods, usually suffixed by 'Deferred'. Also note that the thread's methods are safe to use from both the main and the concurrent thread.
See also:
Thread::start()

Desktop::deferOperation()

void destroyRenderTarget (  Image *  image  ) 
 

Destroys a render target image.

Parameters:
image The image to be destroyed.
See also:
createRenderTarget()

void draw3DRect (  DrawingContext &  context,
Vector  from,
Vector  to,
unsigned long  fillColor,
unsigned long  topLeftBorderColor,
unsigned long  bottomRightBorderColor
) 
 

Draws a rectangle (or square) with colored top-left and bottom-right borders, generating a pseudo-3D effect.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
from The top-left corner position of the rectangle.
to The bottom-right corner position of the rectangle.
fillColor The fill color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color. Use transparent black to omit the filling.
topLeftBorderColor The color to be used for the top and left borders. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color.
bottomRightBorderColor The color to be used for the bottom and right borders. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color.

virtual void drawEllipse (  DrawingContext &  context,
Vector  center,
Vector  radius,
unsigned long  fillColor,
unsigned long  borderColor
)  [virtual]
 

Draws an ellipse (or circle) with (or without) an outline.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
center The center position of the rectangle.
radius The x and y radius of the ellipse. If both coordinates are equal, the method draws a circle.
fillColor The fill color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color. Use transparent black to omit the filling.
borderColor The border color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color. If the border color equals the fill color (which is the default), the ellipse has no outline.

void drawEllipse (  DrawingContext &  context,
Vector  center,
Vector  radius,
unsigned long  fillColor
)  [inline]
 

Draws an ellipse (or circle) without an outline.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
center The center position of the rectangle.
radius The x and y radius of the ellipse. If both coordinates are equal, the method draws a circle.
fillColor The fill color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color. Use transparent black to omit the filling.

virtual void drawImage (  DrawingContext &  context,
Image *  image,
Vector  sourcePosition,
Vector  sourceSize,
Vector  targetPosition,
Vector  targetSize,
unsigned long  modulationColor = GL_WHITE,
BlendType  blendType = BLENDTYPE_NORMAL
)  [virtual]
 

Draws a part of an image with stretching or shrinking.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
image The image to be drawn.
sourcePosition The top-left position to draw the image at.
sourceSize The target image size.
targetPosition The top-left position to draw the image at.
targetSize The target image size.
modulationColor The modulation color to be used. Using GL_WHITE, which is the default, renders the image opaquely. Using GL_WHITE_A(alpha), renders the image using a given alpha value, where 0 is entirely transparent, and 255 is entirely opaque.
blendType How to blend the image on the context's target. Defaults to BLENDTYPE_NORMAL.

blendType How to blend the image on the context's target. Defaults to BLENDTYPE_NORMAL.

virtual void drawMonoText (  DrawingContext &  context,
Font *  font,
Vector  position,
const String &  text,
unsigned long  color,
bool  caps = false,
bool  withHotKeys = false,
bool  ellipse = true
)  [virtual]
 

Draws a mono-colored text at a given position, using a given font and a provided color.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
font The font to be used.
position The top-left position of the text.
text The text to be drawn.
color The color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color.
caps Whether to use all-capital characters. Defaults to false.
withHotKeys Whether ampersand characters ('&') are considered as hot key defining prefixes, resulting in underlined characters. Double ampersands result in a single ampersand to be rendered. Defaults to false.
ellipse Whether to use an ellipse (three periods, '...'), if the text does not fit the context's clipping rectangle. In this case, the text is reduced in a way to fit, leaving out trailing characters, adding the ellipse.

virtual void drawPixel (  DrawingContext &  context,
Vector  position,
unsigned long  color
)  [virtual]

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
position The position of the pixel.
color The color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color.

virtual void drawRotatedImage (  DrawingContext &  context,
Image *  image,
Vector  sourcePosition,
Vector  sourceSize,
Vector  targetPosition,
Vector  targetSize,
Vector  rotationAnchor,
double  rotationAngle,
unsigned long  modulationColor = GL_WHITE,
BlendType  blendType = BLENDTYPE_NORMAL
)  [virtual]
 

Draws a part of an image with stretching or shrinking, and using rotation.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
image The image to be drawn.
sourcePosition The top-left position to draw the image at.
sourceSize The target image size.
targetPosition The top-left position to draw the image at.
targetSize The target image size.
rotationAnchor The position to rotate at. This pixel will stay in position.
rotationAngle The counter-clockwise radians angle to rotate the image.
modulationColor The modulation color to be used. Using GL_WHITE, which is the default, renders the image opaquely. Using GL_WHITE_A(alpha), renders the image using a given alpha value, where 0 is entirely transparent, and 255 is entirely opaque.
blendType How to blend the image on the context's target. Defaults to BLENDTYPE_NORMAL.

Draws a multi-colored text at a given position, using a given font and alpha blending.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
font The font to be used.
position The top-left position of the text.
text The text to be drawn.
alpha The alpha blending value to be used (0 is fully transparent, 255, the default, is fully opaque).
caps Whether to use all-capital characters. Defaults to false.
withHotKeys Whether ampersand characters ('&') are considered as hot key defining prefixes, resulting in underlined characters. Double ampersands result in a single ampersand to be rendered. Defaults to false.
ellipse Whether to use an ellipse (three periods, '...'), if the text does not fit the context's clipping rectangle. In this case, the text is reduced in a way to fit, leaving out trailing characters, adding the ellipse.

virtual void drawTextInternal (  DrawingContext &  context,
Font *  font,
Vector  position,
const String &  text,
unsigned long  modulationColor,
BlendType  blendType,
bool  caps,
bool  withHotKeys,
bool  ellipse
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Draws a multi-colored text at a given position, using a given font and alpha blending.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
font The font to be used.
position The top-left position of the text.
text The text to be drawn.
modulationColor The modulation color to be used. Using GL_WHITE, which is the default, renders the text opaquely. Using GL_WHITE_A(alpha), renders the text using a given alpha value, where 0 is entirely transparent, and 255 is entirely opaque.
blendType How to blend the image on the context's target.
caps Whether to use all-capital characters.
withHotKeys Whether ampersand characters ('&') are considered as hot key defining prefixes, resulting in underlined characters. Double ampersands result in a single ampersand to be rendered. Defaults to false.
ellipse Whether to use an ellipse (three periods, '...'), if the text does not fit the context's clipping rectangle. In this case, the text is reduced in a way to fit, leaving out trailing characters, adding the ellipse.

virtual void drawTriangle (  DrawingContext &  context,
Vector *  vertices,
unsigned long  fillColor,
unsigned long  borderColor
)  [virtual]
 

Draws a triangle with (or without) an outline.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
vertices A vector array with 3 elements, defining the corners of the triangle.
fillColor The fill color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color. Use transparent black to omit the filling.
borderColor The border color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color. If the border color equals the fill color (which is the default), the triangle has no outline.

void drawTriangle (  DrawingContext &  context,
Vector *  vertices,
unsigned long  fillColor
)  [inline]
 

Draws a triangle without an outline.

Parameters:
context The drawing context to be used. The drawing context defines the target surface image and clipping and drawing offsets and sizes.
vertices A vector array with 3 elements, defining the corners of the triangle.
fillColor The fill color to be used. The color consists of alpha, red, green, and blue components. Use the color macros to synthesize this color. Use transparent black to omit the filling.

Font* getFont (  const String &  path  ) 
 

Returns a font by its font file path.

The font is managed by the adapter, so using the font the first time loads it into memory. Consequtive uses return the same instance again.

Parameters:
path The path of the font file.
Returns:
The font. The memory is managed by the adapter, so do not delete it.
See also:
Font::ensureLoaded()

Image* getImage (  const String &  path,
bool  load = false
) 
 

Returns an image by its file path.

The image is managed by the adapter, so using the image the first time loads it into memory. Consequtive uses return the same instance again.

Parameters:
path The path of the image file, may be relative or absolute. Relative paths are relative to the application's executable location.
load Whether to ensure that the image has been cached into memory immediately. Otherwise, the file may be loaded on first use. Defaults to false.
Returns:
The image. The memory is managed by the adapter, so do not delete it.
See also:
Image::ensureLoaded()

virtual unsigned long getPixel (  DrawingContext &  context,
Vector  position
)  [virtual]

position The position to return the pixel color of.
Returns:

virtual void sleep (  unsigned long  time  )  [virtual]
 

Suspends the current thread for a given number of milli seconds.

Parameters:

void sleepWithCheatProtection (  unsigned long  time  ) 
 

Suspends the current thread for a given number of milli seconds, splitting the time into slices to prevent cheating by shifting the clock.

On the other hand, this is a little less accurate.

Parameters:
time The number of milli seconds to wait.
